job_description:
Set Solutions is on the hunt for a Data Scientist for a client in the telecom space. This role is fully remote and is a 6 month contract to hire-they would like to convert at the end of the contract.

For this role, would really like a well rounded Data Scientist that has some exposure to Machine Learning.

Responsibilities:
• Apply advanced machine learning techniques to analyze large datasets and extract actionable insights.
• Develop predictive models to forecast trends and patterns for business optimization.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
• Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify key factors influencing business metrics.
• Utilize statistical methods to validate model performance and ensure accuracy.
• Design and implement data pipelines for efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading.
• Stay updated with the latest advancements in machine learning algorithms and technologies.

Requirements:
• Bachelor's/Master's/Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
• Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in a production environment.
• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
• Strong understanding of statistical concepts and techniques.
• Experience with data visualization tools such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, or Tableau.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
• Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
• Knowledge of big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Hive.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $50.00 - $70.00 per hour

Benefits:
• Health insurance

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift

Experience:
• Machine learning: 3 years (Preferred)
• Cloud computing: 3 years (Preferred)
• Python: 3 years (Preferred)
• R: 3 years (Preferred)
• Dataiku: 2 years (Preferred)
• Snowflake: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

Qualifications: Bachelor's/Master's/Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in a production environment
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and techniques
Experience with data visualization tools such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, or Tableau
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Knowledge of big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Hive
Responsibilities: Apply advanced machine learning techniques to analyze large datasets and extract actionable insights
Develop predictive models to forecast trends and patterns for business optimization
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify key factors influencing business metrics
Utilize statistical methods to validate model performance and ensure accuracy
Design and implement data pipelines for efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading
Stay updated with the latest advancements in machine learning algorithms and technologies
